page.title: 10LANDSCAPE-PORTPATRICK
page.content: Portpatrick is situated in and around a cleft in towering sea-cliffs. Half-a-mile south of the village, ruined Dunskey Castle,an early 16th Century edifice crumbles unheeded on the edge of a precipice,while the farmland and moor behind flow in more gentle contours. Within the village lie the ruins of an early 17th Century cruciform-plan church with attached but earlier four-storey round tower. There is more modern mid-19th Century church and habitations range from early Georgian through Victorian to present day, while the local ultra-modern school is entirely out of keeping with the village. Students of architecture would find much to discuss and comment upon.
